page.title: 09FARMING II
page.content: { {LIVESTOCK {Dairy Cattle-}Five of the farms have dairies including one noted Friesian herd at Rosehill and a noted Ayrshire herd at Muirside. On average 80% are black and white and 20% Ayrshire. 1985 sees the presence of Holstein making a mark. One dairyman now milks up to 180 cows in the parlour system and no cattle are tied by the neck. Milk is sent mainly to the Carnation Milk Factory or is for local distribution {Beef Cattle-}These mainly consist of dairy crosses, Herefords and Charolais {Sheep-}The various breeds are Suffolk, Border Leicester, Half-breds, Mules, Charolais sheep and Texel. {Changes-}There are no pigs, no ducks and no commercial hens in the area though until recently there were piggeries-the last going about 1980.
